intro: Ornithogalum minimum, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and delicate, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it a compact and ornamental choice for gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, and it is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Ornithogalum minimum is also noted for its ability to thrive in rocky or dry environments.
